props.categories: Specifies what categories to display in the `category` view. This controls the order of the categories as well. If the calendar uses events any categories specified in those events not specified in this value are dynamically rendered in the view unless `category-hide-dynamic` is true.
props.categoryHideDynamic: Sets whether categories specified in an event should be hidden if it's not defined in `categories`.
props.categoryShowAll: Set whether the `category` view should show all defined `categories` even if there are no events for a category.
props.categoryForInvalid: The category to place events in that have invalid categories. A category is invalid when it is not a string. By default events without a category are not displayed until this value is specified.
props.categoryDays: The number of days to render in the `category` view.
props.categoryText: If categories is a list of objects, you can use this to determine what property to print out as the category text on the calendar. You can provide a function to do some logic or just define the prop name. It's similar to item-text on v-select
props.dayFormat: Formats day of the month string that appears in a day to a specified locale
props.end: The ending date on the calendar (inclusive) in the format of `YYYY-MM-DD`. This may be ignored depending on the `type` of the calendar.
props.eventCategory: Set property of *event*'s category. Instead of a property a function can be given which takes an event and returns the category.
props.eventColor: A background color for all events or a function which accepts an event object passed to the calendar to return a color.
props.eventHeight: The height of an event in pixels in the `month` view and at the top of the `day` views.
props.eventMore: Whether the more 'button' is displayed on a calendar with too many events in a given day. It will say something like '5 more' and when clicked generates a `click:more` event.
props.eventMoreText: The text to display in the more 'button' given the number of hidden events.
props.eventName: Set property of *event*'s displayed name, or a function which accepts an event object passed to the calendar as the first argument and a flag signalling whether the name is for a timed event (true) or an event over a day.
props.eventOverlapMode: One of `stack`, `column`, or a custom render function
props.eventOverlapThreshold: A value in minutes that's used to determine whether two timed events should be placed in column beside each other or should be treated as slightly overlapping events.
props.events: An array of event objects with a property for a start timestamp and optionally a name and end timestamp. If an end timestamp is not given, the value of start will be used. If no name is given, you must provide an implementation for the `event` slot.
props.eventTextColor: A text color for all events or a function which accepts an event object passed to the calendar to return a color.
props.eventTimed: If Dates or milliseconds are used as the start or end timestamp of an event, this prop can be a string to a property on the event that is truthy if the event is a timed event or a function which takes the event and returns a truthy value if the event is a timed event.
props.firstInterval: The first interval to display in the `day` view. If `intervalMinutes` is set to 60 and this is set to 9 the first time in the view is 9am.
props.firstTime: The first time to display in the `day` view. If specified, this overwrites any `firstInterval` value specified. This can be the number of minutes since midnight, a string in the format of `HH:mm`, or an object with number properties hour and minute.
props.hideHeader: If the header at the top of the `day` view should be visible.
props.intervalCount: The number of intervals to display in the `day` view.
props.intervalFormat: Formats time of day string that appears in the interval gutter of the `day` and `week` view to specified locale
props.intervalHeight: The height of an interval in pixels in the `day` view.
props.intervalWidth: The width of the interval gutter on the left side in the `day` view.
props.intervalMinutes: The number of minutes the intervals are in the `day` view. A common interval is 60 minutes so the intervals are an hour.
props.intervalStyle: Returns CSS styling to apply to the interval.
props.localeFirstDayOfYear: Sets the day that determines the first week of the year, starting with 0 for **Sunday**. For ISO 8601 this should be 4.
props.maxDays: The maximum number of days to display in the custom calendar if an `end` day is not set.
props.minWeeks: The minimum number of weeks to display in the `month` or `week` view.
props.monthFormat: Formats month string that appears in a day to specified locale
props.now: Override the day & time which is considered now. This is in the format of `YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss`. The calendar is styled according to now.
props.shortIntervals: If true, the intervals in the `day` view will be 9 AM as opposed to 09:00 AM
props.shortMonths: Whether the short versions of a month should be used (Jan vs January).
props.shortWeekdays: Whether the short versions of a weekday should be used (Mon vs Monday).
props.showIntervalLabel: Checks if a given day and time should be displayed in the interval gutter of the `day` view.
props.showMonthOnFirst: Whether the name of the month should be displayed on the first day of the month.
props.showWeek: Whether week numbers should be displayed when using the `month` view.
props.start: The starting date on the calendar (inclusive) in the format of `YYYY-MM-DD`. This may be ignored depending on the `type` of the calendar.
props.type: A string which is one of `month`, `week`, `day`, `4day`, `custom-weekly`, `custom-daily`, and `category`. The custom types look at the `start` and `end` dates passed to the component as opposed to the `value`.
props.v-model: Sets the `value` property but also updates it when the link of a day is clicked.
props.value: A date in the format of `YYYY-MM-DD` which determines what span of time for the calendar.
props.weekdayFormat: Formats day of the week string that appears in the header to specified locale
props.weekdays: Specifies which days of the week to display. To display Monday through Friday only, a value of `[1, 2, 3, 4, 5]` can be used. To display a week starting on Monday a value of `[1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 0]` can be used.

slots.category: The content placed in a category header for the `category` type. The category variable is null for events with invalid (non-string) categories.
slots.day-body: The content that is placed in a `day` view in the scrollable interval container. The day & time object is passed through this slots scope.
slots.day-header: The content that is placed in a `day` view in the top container. The day & time object is passed through this slots scope.
slots.day-label: The content that is placed in the day of the month space in the `custom-weekly` or `month` view. The day & time object is passed through this slots scope.
slots.day-label-header: The content that is placed in the day of the month space in the `week`, `day`, `4day`, or `custom-daily` view. The day & time object is passed through this slots scope.
slots.day-month: The content that is placed in the month space in the `week` or `month` view. The day & time object is passed through this slots scope.
slots.day: The content that is placed in a `week` or `month` view. The day & time object is passed through this slots scope.
slots.event: The content placed in an event. This ignores the `event-name` prop.
slots.interval: The content that is placed in the interval space in the `day` view. The day & time object is passed through this slots scope.
slots.interval-header: The content that is placed in the interval space in the top left of the `day` view.

events.change: The range of days displayed on the calendar changed. This is triggered on initialization. The event passed is an object with start and end date objects.
events.click:date: The click event on the day of the month link. The event passed is the day & time object.
events.click:day: The click event on a day. The event passed is the day object.
events.click:day-category: The click event on a day in the `category` view. The event passed is the day object.
events.click:event: The click event on a specific event. The event passed is the day & time object.
events.click:interval: The click event at a specific interval label in the `day` view. The event passed is the day & time object.
events.click:more: The click event on the `X more` button on views with too many events in a day.
events.click:time: The click event at a specific time in the `day` view. The event passed is the day & time object.
events.click:time-category: The click event at a specific time in the `category` view. The event passed is the day & time object.
events.contextmenu:date: The right-click event on the day of the month link. The event passed is the day & time object.
events.contextmenu:day: The right-click event on a day. The event passed is the day object.
events.contextmenu:day-category: The right-click event on a day in the `category` view. The event passed is the day object.
events.contextmenu:event: The right-click event on an event. The event passed is the day & time object.
events.contextmenu:interval: The right-click event at a specific interval label in the `day` view. The event passed is the day & time object.
events.contextmenu:time: The right-click event at a specific time in the `day` view. The event passed is the day & time object.
events.contextmenu:time-category: The right-click event at a specific time in the `category` view. The event passed is the day & time object.
events.input: An alias to the `click:date` event used to support v-model.
events.mousedown:day: The mousedown event on a day. The event passed is the day object.
events.mousedown:day-category: The mousedown event on a day in the `category` view. The event passed is the day object.
events.mousedown:event: The mousedown event on an event. The event passed is the day & time object.
events.mousedown:interval: The mousedown event at a specific interval label in the `day` view. The event passed is the day & time object.
events.mousedown:time: The mousedown event at a specific time in the `day` view. The event passed is the day & time object.
events.mousedown:time-category: The mousedown event at a specific time in the `category` view. The event passed is the day & time object.
events.mouseenter:day: The mouseenter event on a day. The event passed is the day object.
events.mouseenter:day-category: The mouseenter event on a day in the `category` view. The event passed is the day object.
events.mouseenter:event: The mouseenter event on an event. The event passed is the day & time object.
events.mouseenter:interval: The mouseenter event at a specific interval label in the `day` view. The event passed is the day & time object.
events.mouseenter:time: The mouseenter event at a specific time in the `day` view. The event passed is the day & time object.
events.mouseenter:time-category: The mouseenter event at a specific time in the `category` view. The event passed is the day & time object.
events.mouseleave:day: The mouseleave event on a day. The event passed is the day object.
events.mouseleave:day-category: The mouseleave event on a day in the `category` view. The event passed is the day object.
events.mouseleave:event: The mouseleave event on an event. The event passed is the day & time object.
events.mouseleave:interval: The mouseleave event at a specific interval label in the `day` view. The event passed is the day & time object.
events.mouseleave:time: The mouseleave event at a specific time in the `day` view. The event passed is the day & time object.
events.mouseleave:time-category: The mouseleave event at a specific time in the `category` view. The event passed is the day & time object.
events.mousemove:day: The mousemove event on a day. The event passed is the day object.
events.mousemove:day-category: The mousemove event on a day in the `category` view. The event passed is the day object.
events.mousemove:event: The mousemove event on an event. The event passed is the day & time object.
events.mousemove:interval: The mousemove event at a specific interval label in the `day` view. The event passed is the day & time object.
events.mousemove:time: The mousemove event at a specific time in the `day` view. The event passed is the day & time object.
events.mousemove:time-category: The mousemove event at a specific time in the `category` view. The event passed is the day & time object.
events.mouseup:day: The mouseup event on a day. The event passed is the day object.
events.mouseup:day-category: The mouseup event on a day in the `category` view. The event passed is the day object.
events.mouseup:event: The mouseup event on an event. The event passed is the day & time object.
events.mouseup:interval: The mouseup event at a specific interval label in the `day` view. The event passed is the day & time object.
events.mouseup:time: The mouseup event at a specific time in the `day` view. The event passed is the day & time object.
events.mouseup:time-category: The mouseup event at a specific time in the `category` view. The event passed is the day & time object.
events.moved: One of the functions `next`, `prev`, and `move` was called. The event passed is the day object calculated for the movement.
events.touchend:day: The touchend event on a day. The event passed is the day object.
events.touchend:day-category: The touchend event on a day in the `category` view. The event passed is the day object.
events.touchend:event: The touchend event on am view. The event passed is the day & time object.
events.touchend:interval: The touchend event at a specific interval label in the `day` view. The event passed is the day & time object.
events.touchend:time: The touchend event at a specific time in the `day` view. The event passed is the day & time object.
events.touchend:time-category: The touchend event at a specific time in the `category` view. The event passed is the day & time object.
events.touchmove:day: The touchmove event on a day. The event passed is the day object.
events.touchmove:day-category: The touchmove event on a day in the `category` view. The event passed is the day object.
events.touchmove:event: The touchmove event on an `event` view. The event passed is the day & time object.
events.touchmove:interval: The touchmove event at a specific interval label in the `day` view. The event passed is the day & time object.
events.touchmove:time: The touchmove event at a specific time in the `day` view. The event passed is the day & time object.
events.touchmove:time-category: The touchmove event at a specific time in the `category` view. The event passed is the day & time object.
events.touchstart:day: The touchstart event on a day. The event passed is the day object.
events.touchstart:day-category: The touchstart event on a day in the `category` view. The event passed is the day object.
events.touchstart:event: The touchstart event on an event` view. The event passed is the day & time object.
events.touchstart:interval: The touchstart event at a specific interval label in the `day` view. The event passed is the day & time object.
events.touchstart:time: The touchstart event at a specific time in the `day` view. The event passed is the day & time object.
events.touchstart:time-category: The touchstart event at a specific time in the `category` view. The event passed is the day & time object.

functions.checkChange: Checks for change in start and end dates. Updates and emits a change event if they have changed.
functions.formatTime: A utility function to take a timestamp object (at least has hour and minute properties) and generates a time as a string.
functions.getFormatter: A utility function given options to pass to Intl.DateTimeFormat and returns a function which can be given a Date to format as a string.
functions.minutesToPixels: Converts minutes to a pixel value on the y-axis for the `day` view. If the view is not `day` then -1 is returned.
functions.move: A generic function that moves the calendar next (if amount is positive) or previous (if amount is negative).
functions.next: Triggers the input event with a date that would progress the calendar to the next timespan. If the type is `month` it will return a day in the next month, if the type is `4day` it will return a date 4 days after `value`/`v-model`, etc.
functions.prev: Triggers the input event with a date that would progress the calendar to the previous timespan. If the type is `month` it will return a day in the previous month, if the type is `4day` it will return a date 4 days before `value`/`v-model`, etc.
functions.scrollToTime: Scrolls the scrollable area in the `day` view to the given time. If the time is not in a valid format or if the calendar is not in the `day` view then false is returned.
functions.timeToY: Converts a time to a pixel value on the y-axis for the `day` view. If the time is not in a valid format or if the calendar is not in the `day` view then false is returned.
functions.timeDelta: Converts a time to a delta value for the `day` view. If the time is not in a valid format or if the calendar is not in the `day` view then false is returned. A delta value is typically between 0 and 1. If the time given is before the first interval then a negative number will be returned. If the time given is after the last interval than a number greater than 1 will be returned.
functions.updateEventVisibility: If the calendar has events and `event-more` is truthy the days with too many events contain a 'button' to represent how many events had to be hidden.
functions.updateTimes: Updates now & today in the calendar, possibly updating the styles in the calendar.
functions.getVisibleEvents:
Returns the list of events seen on the current calendar where each element returned has the following properties:
- `input`: the event passed in the `events` prop.
- `start`: a CalendarTimestamp of the start timestamp parsed.
- `startIdentifier`: a number which represents the day the event starts on.
- `startTimestampIdentifier`: a number which represents the day and time the event starts on.
- `end`: a CalendarTimestamp of the end timestamp parsed.
- `endIdentifier`: a number which represents the day the event ends on.
- `endTimestampIdentifier`: a number which represents the day & time the event ends on.
- `allDay`: if this is an all-day event (has no time specified in the `start`/`end` on the event).
- `index`: the index of the event in the given array.
- `category`: the category of the event if the calendar type is category, otherwise false.
functions.parseTimestamp: A utility function which takes timestamp input and returns a timestamp object.
functions.timestampToDate: A utility function which takes timestamp and returns a Date.
functions.parseEvent: A utility function which takes an event and returns the parsed version of that event.
